intro: Dufrenoya poilanei, commonly known as the Malabar dufrenoyaceae, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Dufrenoyaceae. It is native to the Western Ghats of India and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features include a woody stem and white or pale yellow flowers that bloom during the rainy season. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
